browser-action.name: openbrowser
browser-action.description:
Open a new browser.
Possible parameters are: - browser (required): Browser type, possible values are: [chromium, firefox, webkit] Default value is "chromium". - headless (optional): Whether to run browser in headless mode. - defaultTimeout (optional): Sets the default timeout for every action in ms. Default value is 30000. - defaultNavigationTimeout (optional): Sets the default timeout for every navigation in ms. Default value is 10000. - resolution (optional): Resolution (width x height) of browser. Example: 1920x1080 - locale (optional): Locale of the browser. Example: en-GB - timezone (optional): Timezone of the context - blockRoute (optional): Block all resources related to the given route. Example: `https:\/\/neoload-api\.saas\.neotys\.com\/v3\/.*` to block all v3 api requests from https://neoload-api.saas.neotys.com/v3. `.*\.(png|jpg|jpeg)` to block all images resources. Note: images embedded in html (SVG, base64 etc...) won't be blocked - userAgent (optional): User agent of the browser - header (optional): Adds the specified header to each requests sent by the browser. You can add as many "header" parameter as you need. This parameter expected format is "(HeaderHost) HeaderName=HeaderValue" or "HeaderName=HeaderValue". If HeaderHost is empty, header will affect every requests. Otherwise, header will only affect requests addressed to this host - ignoreSSLCertificateErrors (optional): Ignore SSL certificate errors (expired, untrusted, wrong host certificate, etc.). It is not recommended for security matters. Default value is "false". - bypassCsp (optional): Set this parameter to "true" to bypass all content security policies in the browser context. Default value is "false". - geolocation (optional): Overrides the detected geolocation in the browser. Expected format is "latitude;longitude;accuracy". Values should be in decimal format. - permissions (optional): Adds the specified permissions in the current browser context. The expected value is a comma-separated list of permissions. Example "geolocation, notifications, camera, microphone" - channel (optional): Browser distribution channel, possible values are: chrome, chrome-beta, chrome-dev, chrome-canary, msedge, msedge-beta, msedge-dev, msedge-canary - executablePath (optional): Path to a browser executable to run instead of the bundled one. Note that Playwright only works with the bundled Chromium, Firefox or WebKit, use at your own risk.
